questions.question: What is the maximum recommended time between urine collection and analysis to preserve specimen integrity?
questions.explanation: Urine should be analyzed within 2 hours of collection to prevent bacterial proliferation and cellular degradation.

questions.question: Which urinary cast is most strongly associated with nephrotic syndrome?
questions.explanation: Fatty casts and oval fat bodies are classical findings in nephrotic syndrome due to lipiduria.

questions.question: Which microscopic urine analysis finding indicates glomerular bleeding?
questions.explanation: RBC casts originate from the renal tubules and are indicative of glomerular origin bleeding.

questions.question: Which stain is used to detect fecal fat in stool samples?
questions.explanation: Sudan III is used to visualize neutral lipids (triglycerides and fatty acids) in feces.

questions.question: What cell type predominates in cerebrospinal fluid during viral meningitis?
questions.explanation: Lymphocytic pleocytosis is characteristic of viral (aseptic) meningitis.

questions.question: Which body fluid appears milky due to high triglyceride content?
questions.explanation: Chylous effusions contain milky lymph fluid rich in triglycerides due to lymphatic leakage.

questions.question: What is considered normal progressive sperm motility percentage in a semen analysis?
questions.explanation: According to WHO guidelines, normal progressive motility is 50% or higher.

questions.question: What effect does light exposure have on measured urine bilirubin?
questions.explanation: Urine bilirubin is light-sensitive and will degrade, causing falsely low readings.

questions.question: Which parasitic egg is commonly found in midday urine specimens in endemic areas?
questions.explanation: S. haematobium eggs are best detected in urine collected around midday when egg excretion peaks.

questions.question: Which quality control measure ensures accurate urine microscopy results?
questions.explanation: Standardized containers and proper technique help ensure reproducible and reliable microscopy results.
